ControlledConcept.gml:description: Right-lateral separation sense; in plan view, the side opposite the observer appears displaced to the right. Source: GGIC vocabularies working group (Australia)
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:FaultMovementSense:200811:dextral
ControlledConcept.name: dextral

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Left-lateral separation sense; in plan view, the side opposite the observer appears displaced to the left. Source: GGIC vocabularies working group (Australia)
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:FaultMovementSense:200811:sinistral
ControlledConcept.name: sinistral

ControlledConcept.gml:description: The hanging wall appears to have moved down relative to the footwall; dip of fault usually 45-90 degrees. Source: GGIC vocabularies working group (Australia)
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:FaultMovementSense:200811:normal
ControlledConcept.name: normal

ControlledConcept.gml:description: A regional-scale low-angle normal fault. Source: GGIC vocabularies working group (Australia)
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:FaultMovementSense:200811:detachment
ControlledConcept.name: detachment

ControlledConcept.gml:description: The hanging wall appears to have moved down relative to the footwall; dip of fault usually greater than 45 degrees. Source: GGIC vocabularies working group (Australia)
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:FaultMovementSense:200811:reverse
ControlledConcept.name: reverse

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Reverse fault with dip typically less than 45 degrees; horizontal compression, rather than vertical displacement is characteristic. Source: GGIC vocabularies working group (Australia)
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:FaultMovementSense:200811:thrust
ControlledConcept.name: thrust

ControlledConcept.gml:description: A regional-scale low-angle thrust fault. Source: GeoScience Victoria and others
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:FaultMovementSense:200811:thrust_decollement
ControlledConcept.name: thrust decollement

ControlledConcept.gml:description: The movement sense includes both normal and dextral components. Source: GGIC vocabularies working group (Australia)
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:FaultMovementSense:200811:normal_dextral
ControlledConcept.name: normal dextral

ControlledConcept.gml:description: The movement sense includes both normal and sinistral components. Source: GGIC vocabularies working group (Australia)
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:FaultMovementSense:200811:normal_sinistral
ControlledConcept.name: normal sinistral

ControlledConcept.gml:description: The movement sense includes both reverse and dextral components. Source: GGIC vocabularies working group (Australia)
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:FaultMovementSense:200811:reverse_dextral
ControlledConcept.name: reverse dextral

ControlledConcept.gml:description: The movement sense includes both reverse and sinistral components. Source: GGIC vocabularies working group (Australia)
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:FaultMovementSense:200811:reverse_sinistral
ControlledConcept.name: reverse sinistral

ControlledConcept.gml:description: A large-displacement (kilometers or tens of kilometers) shallowly dipping to subhorizontal fault or shear zone. Source: Neuendorf et al. 2005
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:FaultMovementSense:200811:generic_decollement
ControlledConcept.name: generic decollement

ControlledConcept.gml:description: The fault-parallel displacement is effectively zero, as in an extraction fault. Source: Froitzheim, N., Pleuger, J. & Nagel, T.J., 2006. Extraction faults. Journal of Structural Geology v28, pp. 1388-1395.
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:FaultMovementSense:200811:no_movement_sense
ControlledConcept.name: no movement sense
